segments.text: She's so focused on her task, polishing that plate with such care.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But how can she not feel the water?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The sink is truly gushing over, a continuous sheet of water.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's covering the cabinet doors and spreading rapidly across the floor.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her foot is literally submerged in the puddle, yet her face is blank.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I find it a bit disgusting, honestly, to be standing in dirty water like that.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: There's no visible plug, so the drain must just be completely blocked.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I worry she might slip at any moment.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The idea of her falling with all those dishes is unsettling.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Itâ€™s a peculiar kind of serenity she exhibits.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It feels almost unreal, her complete unawareness.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can't imagine being so deep in thought.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This situation is just begging for an accident.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The mess this is making is truly unfortunate.
segments.speaker: PAR
